author: Devin Kupka

text: lmao me too
author: MrGoat

text: Truly a special theme this, one of the greats. This theme means alot to me, even as a kid i could tell it was something special. From the awesome build up at the beginning that just gets behind you, it drives you into the awesome adventure that was the world. It's richer than anything around at the time (and still now), that touch of melancholy but excitement, man what a song. To me the build up at the start and the whole thing says 'you know what?, screw it, let's get to the awesome part and stay there because it's awesome'. There's a feeling of freedom in the song. Anyway just thought i'd comment on prob the most iconic super turrican song :)
author: Brenton P

text: Your description of the melancholy but filled with excitement is perfect for this track.  Very well said, a 16 bit classic theme for sure!
author: EZ Peezy

text: Anyone else get an 80's pop music vibe from this? Good song. Too bad I wasn't much of a gamer back then.

text: Definitely. Give this vocals, extend it a bit, and it could literally sound like an 80s synthpop song. I'd have no clue it was even an SNES track if no one told me.

text: It's cool that Super Turrican and Mega Turrican have such different styles to their songs, yet the same songs are playing in either game.
author: Moop Bread

text:
I'm gonna be 'that guy' and refer you to the definitive Turrican game soundtracks, found on the Commodore Amiga 500 home computer versions.
  
Well, I didn't see anyone else say it on this comments thread yet.

You'll find the Super Turrican soundtrack is pretty much the same as Turrican 3 on Amiga.

text: In some aspects, I prefer the way some of the songs sound on the SNES and the way they sound in the Amiga/Genesis version.
